title: [CRN-QA] Report field formulas: Report name is not updated to “Report field value {field:Test text}” and app crash observed

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
**Issue Reported by** : Applause Internal Team


**Expected Result:**
Report name updated to Report field value {field:Test text}

**Actual Result:**
Report not updated and displayed as Report field value updated. App crash observed when deleting the report field and navigating to the workspace chat


**Actions Performed:**
Testing account configured for "Custom report formula" by running the snippets


1. Go to the workspace settings > Report
2. Enable report fields (if needed)
3. Add a report field
4. Set the name to “Test text”, type Text, initial value to “initial”
5. Save the field
6. Select the “Default report title”
7. Enter “Report field value {field:Test text}” and save it
8. Open the expense report
9. Verify the report name is “Report field value initial”
10. Set the report field to “updated”
11. Verify the report name is updated to “Report field value updated”
12. Set the report field to “{field:Test text}”

And more steps, see the video


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/64e7dfec-1f75-472e-92ae-1bbab24580e6

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @DylanDylann</details>

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.15-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-825/folder/13176706/41236840/899329345 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjoinsjidosjois@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace settings > Company cards. 3. Add two card feeds 4. Click Add Card > United States > Commerical feed > click on one of the options > enter random numbers (ex. '1'), Next > Submit. 5. Click on the card feed > click Add Card to add the second feed. 6. Go to Overview > Plan type. 7. Click Collect. 8. Click Downgrade workspace. 10. Click "keep only one card feed" link. BUG 1: Company card page is blanked out briefly. 12. Click on one of the feeds > Settings > Remove card feed 10. Go to Overview > Plan type. 11. Click Collect. 12. Click Save. 13. Click Downgrade workspace. 14. Click Got it, thanks. 15. Go to Company cards. BUG 2: Downgrade workspace RHP appears briefly when navigating to Company cards. ## Expected Result: BUG 1: Company card page will not blank out after clicking "keep only one card feed" link. BUG 2: Downgrade workspace RHP will not appear when navigating to Company cards. ## Actual Result: BUG 1: Company card page is blanked out briefly after clicking "keep only one card feed" link. BUG 2: Downgrade workspace RHP appears briefly when navigating to Company cards. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/13c201fe-ad3d-46b4-a053-57faf3b66d6f [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.15-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-828/folder/13176922/41237504/899332465 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1811@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb) **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create a manual expense. 4. Navigate to "Reports" > "Submit" 5. Note that footer displays the correct information on "Expenses" and "Total Spend" fields. 6. Force offline using troubleshoot option. 7. Open the just created expense. 8. Edit the expense amount. 9. Return to "Reports" 10. Note that "Total Spend" field, still displays the old amount. 11. Turn on internet connection. 12. Note that "Total Spend" field, still displays the old amount. 13. Navigate to a different section and return to "Reports" > "Submit" 14. Note that "Total Spend" field is now updated. ## Expected Result: "Total Spend" field displayed on footer on "Submit" section, should be automatically updated after editing the amount of an expense. ## Actual Result: "Total Spend" field, displayed on footer on "Submit" section on "Reports", is not updated after editing the amount of an expense while offline and returning to online mode. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8602fa5e-dd8e-470c-a961-53423e69e61c [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
## Background Related (internal) issue where this was discussed: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/545698 ## Details We'd like to update this screen on **web/desktop ONLY**: ## Updates [(Figma)](https://www.figma.com/design/h9Qd3CtNMtDo9ucblrUQbR/Text-receipts-to-47777-Promo-Banner?node-id=52-3553&p=f&t=f3q2QsTzU1YNvee0-11) The screen should be dynamic for these four scenarios: 1. body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.14-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** N/A **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+ck915252@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ** ## Action Performed: Precondtion: Workspace connected to verified Regions BA 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Navigate to workspace overview 3. Observe the following message is displayed "The default currency can't be changed because this workspace is linked to a USD bank account" & user cannot the default currency 4. Go to Workflows page 5. Toggle off & on the Make & track payments option 6. Go back to workspace overview 7. Observe user has option to change default currency now with a message saying "All expenses on this workspace will be converted to this currency." 8. Click the currency option 9. Observe Not here page opens ## Expected Result: On step 7 - After disabling & enable make & track payments, user should not have an option to change workspace default currency in overview page Default currency option should not be clickable & still displays the same message as in step 3 "The default currency can't be changed because this workspace is linked to a USD bank account" ## Actual Result: After disabling & enable make & track payments in workflows page, User has on option to change workspace defaullt currency which opens Not here page ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
